title: Defining Simplified Fraction
text: A fraction is considered simplified if there are no common factors in its numerator and denominator.
speech: A fraction is considered simplified if there are no common factors in its numerator and denominator.
pacedSpeech: A fraction is considered simplified if there are no common factors in its numerator and denominator.

title: Finding Common Factors
text: If we find the common factor of the numerator and the denominator, we can easily use the equivalent fractions property to simplify the fraction.
speech: If we find the common factor of the numerator and the denominator, we can easily use the equivalent fractions property to simplify the fraction.
pacedSpeech: If we find the common factor of the numerator and the denominator, we can easily use the equivalent fractions property to simplify the fraction.

title: Finding Common Factors
text: What is the largerst common factor between $$42$$ and 54?

subHints.title: Finding Common Factors
subHints.text: We can rewrite $$42$$ as $$6\times7$$ and $$54$$ as $$6\times9$$, which tells us that the largest common factor is $$6$$.

speech: What is the largerst common factor between  42  and 54?

title: Equivalent Fractions Property
text: We can then use the equivalent fractions property to simpily the fraction, which states that if a, $$b$$, c are numbers where $$b \neq 0$$, $$c \neq 0$$, then $$\frac{a}{b}=\frac{a c}{b c}$$.
speech: We can then use the equivalent fractions property to simpily the fraction, which states that if a,  b , c are numbers where  b, is not equal to, 0 ,  c, is not equal to 0 , then  a over b is equal to fraction, a c, over, b c,  .

title: Final Answer
text: In the previous steps, we rewrite $$\frac{-42}{54}$$ as $$\frac{-\left(6\times7\right)}{6\times9}$$. Observe this fraction. What can we simplify it to?
